group.name: FPP-base
group.description: First part of a base sequence of two ordered turns of talk.
group.example:
A: "What time is it?"	FPP-base
B: "Three o clock."	SPP-base

group.name: SPP-base
group.description: Second part of a base sequence of two ordered turns of talk.
group.example:
A: "What time is it?"	FPP-base
B: "Three o clock."	SPP-base

group.name: FPP-pre
group.description: Pre-expansions are preliminary to a base sequence, as preludes to some other action.
group.example:
A: "What you doing?"	FPP-pre
B: "Not much."	SPP-pre
A: "Wanna drink?"	FPP-base

group.name: SPP-pre
group.description: Pre-expansions are preliminary to a base sequence, as preludes to some other action.
group.example:
A: "What you doing?"	FPP-pre
B: "Not much."	SPP-pre
A: "Wanna drink?"	FPP-base

group.name: Pre
group.description: Minimal-pre-expansions are preliminary to a base sequence, with only one speaker turn.
group.example:
A: "My tooth hurts..."	Pre
A: "When is my dentist appointment?"	FPP-base

group.name: FPP-insert
group.description: Insert-expansions occur between base adjacency pairs, interrupting the activity previously underway, but are still relevant to that action.
group.example:
A: "Do you know the directions?"	FPP-base
B: "You driving or walking?"	FPP-insert
A: "Walking."	SPP-insert
B: "Get on the subway."	SPP-base

group.name: SPP-insert
group.description: Insert-expansions occur between base adjacency pairs, interrupting the activity previously underway, but are still relevant to that action.
group.example:
A: "Do you know the directions?"	FPP-base
B: "You driving or walking?"	FPP-insert
A: "Walking."	SPP-insert
B: "Get on the subway."	SPP-base

group.name: Insert
group.description: Minimal-insert-expansions occur between base adjacency pairs, with only one speaker turn.
group.example:
A: "When is my dentist appointment?"	FPP-base
A: "Who am I going with?"	Insert
B: "The appointment is at 11 am with your Aunt."	SPP-base

group.name: FPP-post
group.description: Post-expansions occur after the completion of the base SPP with talk that is recognisably associated with the preceding sequence.
group.example:
B: "Forecast for cloudy skies tomorrow."	SPP-base
A: "Okay."	FPP-post
B: "No problem."	SPP-post

group.name: SPP-post
group.description: Post-expansions occur after the completion of the base SPP with talk that is recognisably associated with the preceding sequence.
group.example:
B: "Forecast for cloudy skies tomorrow."	SPP-base
A: "Okay."	FPP-post
B: "No problem."	SPP-post

group.name: Post
group.description: Minimal-post-expansions expand talk after the base SPP, with only one speaker turn.
group.example:
B: "The appointment is at 11 am with your Aunt."	SPP-base
A: "Thanks."	Post

group.name: propQuestion
group.description: Propositional questions imply a yes/no answer but do not necessarily require one.

group.name: setQuestion
group.example: "How far is it to the station?"

group.name: choiceQuestion
group.description: Choice between two or more options.

group.name: checkQuestion
group.description: Check on information that the speaker believes is correct.

group.name: inform
group.description: State, explain, elaborate etc, some information.

group.name: answer
group.description: Senders response to a question of addressee.
group.example:
S: "what does the display say?"
A: "Send error document ready."

group.name: correction
group.description: Informs addressee that their information is incorrect and the senders is correct.

group.name: agreement
group.description: Sender informs addressee that a given proposition is true.

group.name: disagreement
group.description: Sender informs addressee that a given proposition is false.
group.example:
S: "Do you know where to find the ink cartridge?"
A: "Oh I think to the left of the paper."
S: "Uh... no."

group.name: confirm
group.description: Informs addressee that information about which they are uncertain is indeed correct.

group.name: disconfirm
group.description: Informs addressee that information about which they are uncertain is incorrect.

group.name: offer
group.description: Sender indicates willingness and ability to perform an action.
group.example: "Let me look that up for you."

group.name: addressOffer
group.description: Sender is considering that the possibility that the addressee performs the action, possibly with certain conditions that they make explicit.

group.name: acceptOffer
group.description: Sender informs addressee that they would like them to perform an offered action.

group.name: declineOffer
group.description: Sender informs addressee that they would not like them to perform an offered action.

group.name: request
group.description: Sender asks addressee to commit to performing a certain action.

group.name: addressRequest
group.description: Sender indicates that they will consider the performance of an action that they were requested to perform, possibly depending on certain conditions that they make explicit.
group.example:
A: "Please give me the gun."
S: "If you push the bag to me."

group.name: acceptRequest
group.description: Sender commits them self to perform an action that they have been requested to perform

group.name: declineRequest
group.description: Sender indicates that they refuse to perform an action that they have been requested to perform.

group.name: suggest
group.description: Sender asks addressee to consider performance of an action they believe is in the addressee's interest and is able to perform.
group.example: "Let's wait for the speaker to finish."

group.name: addressSuggest
group.description: Sender indicates that they will consider the performance of an action that was suggested to them, possibly depending on certain conditions that they make explicit.
group.example:
A: "Let's go there together."
S: "Only if we're in full agreement about the way to proceed when we get there."

group.name: acceptSuggest
group.description: Sender commits them self to perform an action that was suggested to them.

group.name: declineSuggest
group.description: Sender indicates that they will not perform an action that was suggested.

group.name: feedbackPos
group.description: Sender informs addressee their processing of the previous utterance(s) was successful.

group.name: feedbackNeg
group.description: Sender informs addressee their processing of the previous utterance(s) was not successful.

group.name: stalling
group.description: Sender creates a little extra time to construct their contribution or to suspend the dialogue for a short while.

group.name: retraction
group.description: Sender withdraws or abandons something that they just said within the same turn.

group.name: initialGreeting
group.description: Sender informs the addressee that they are present.

group.name: returnGreeting
group.description: Sender acknowledges they are aware of addressee and the addressee has signalled their presence.

group.name: initialGoodbye
group.description: Sender informs the addressee that they intend the current utterance to be their final contribution to the dialogue.

group.name: returnGoodbye
group.description: Sender acknowledges their awareness that the addressee has signalled their final contribution to the dialogue and signals their agreement.

group.name: thanking
group.description: Sender informs the addressee that they are grateful for some action performed.

group.name: acceptThanking
group.description: Sender indicates understanding of the feelings of gratitude which the addressee has expressed.

group.name: apology
group.description: Sender signal they want the addressee to know that they regret something.

group.name: acceptApology
group.description: Sender indicates understanding of the feelings of regret which the addressee has expressed.
